name: RIVER from the HILL, SAND, RIVER Collection
description:
The RIVER Set is beautiful and bright, a surprising and uplifting burst of color inspired by Cambodia, a country that surprised me in the same way. We walked one day, all day, through the city of Phnom Penh, along the riverbanks where the Mekong meets the Tonle Sap, where the waters in the dry season moved by slow, early morning mist and dusty streets, into the deep pinks of lotus buds and red and gold incense sticks at the temples, fading French-Indochine-era tiles inside bright yellow-painted buildings, markets with bright fish and flowers and fruit, gem-toned silk costumes of the Apsara dance, a production by a children's troupe working hard to revive the arts and culture of Cambodia that was almost lost forever in the 70's. This set of necklaces evokes depth and light and all the bright spots in between where I think love and hope must live. I love it on my friend P., who wears the short and medium RIVER necklaces with a heather grey scoop neck and jeans and it's just so beautiful on her, the colors both serene and poppy at the same time, but I can see this dressed up on a little black party dress for a night out or peeking out from a chambray button-down while you paint your masterpiece.

The beads we use exclusively are old. Old as 1890's Paris and produced in gorgeous colors difficult to find today, collected on our trips to France over the years, and are sewn directly into the chain on strong thread, a technique we have perfected since 2008. They are sturdy and beautiful and these are a striking choice, full of life, when all you want to feel is joy. Handmade in our NYC studio. Please allow 10-14 days for production.

-THE shortest is Mekong (19"), a beautiful soft neutral for quiet everydays in rainwater blue, gloss white, soft mist and cobalt seed beads, the oldest here from Pre-War Paris. 

-The medium is Blue Lotus (24") designed with a semi-symmetrical mix of larger 1920's & 30's Parisian and African beads and stacking zig-zag rondels in cobalt, black wave, dove grey, cloud white and citron, this middle size is a bright bold piece and is gorgeous and eye-catching on it's own but when it's paired with one or both of the shorter or longer necklaces from the HILL Collection, it truly dazzles.

-The longest is Apsara (30"), delicate in size but dazzling in a row of ultramarine, aquamarine, citron yellows, (some with undertones of the little limes found in Cambodia), soft mist, rainwater blue, plum and just a little spot of tangerine to soften the tones. A thoughtful pattern, a mix of matte and shiny, the colors are misty and soft and bright at the same time. The seed and tube beads range from the Jazz-age Paris of the 1920's through the "Parapluies de Cherbourg" 1960's.

Bought separately, we'll donate $5 from your purchase to Room to Read, an organization supporting education for girls across Asia and Africa. $5 will buy a book for a child but you'll be donating $20 if you buy the whole set--enough for an entire shelf of books for a school library--and we'll go further take $20 off your purchase of a set! Please visit our ROOM TO READ page for more details on our project. Wearing our necklaces and knowing that what you've bought has provided books for deserving little girls on the other side of the world is just a beautiful way to feel we are all sisters (and brothers too).

To see more pictures and where our inspiration springs from our journeys around the world visit our blog, Your Destiny is Stone Golden or come see us on Instagram at bonbonoiseau.

name: HILL from the HILL, SAND, RIVER COLLECTION
description:
These are your favorite greens of lush fern and moss and palms. These are the blues clear as openings in the sky when the clouds move away. These are the colors I always go back to because I see in rain green. The HILL necklaces about my first trips in India, always straight to the Himalayan hills and always during the Monsoon, but this last visit was way South, a trip to Munnar, a tea producing town in the Nilgiri Hills of the Western Ghats of Kerala: wet green slopes with tea as far as the eye can see with soft and striking gray mist in front of monsoon clouds like the swirls in Indian Miniatures, moss covering everything, crumbling cement, a swish of the bright silks of ladies saris and raincoats and umbrellas rushing the rain, the French and cobalt blue of school uniforms on little braided girls marching to school. There has never been anything as awe-inspiring to me as the monsoon in India and these necklaces are the beautiful, ethereal pure deep colors I remember, the ones that root you to the earth, and really, they are the colors of strong girls who aren't afraid to get their hands dirty. This set has my heart because it just *feels* so great with my new soft blue slate long-sleeved tee. But you can wear it with your pretty white lace blouse too, with skinny black pants. Or the other way around...

The beads we use exclusively are old as 1890's Paris produced in gorgeous colors difficult to find today and collected on our trips to France over the years. They are sewn directly on strong thread into the chain, a technique we have perfected since 2008. They are sturdy and beautiful and the HILL set is an ethereal, cool choice, perfect in any season. Handmade in our NYC studio. Please allow 10-14 days for production.

-THE shortest is Munnari (19"), in soft whisper tones of very special Art Nouveau-era jade colors and hand-cut pyrite seed beads from Paris. 

-The medium is Nilgiri (24"), designed with a semi-symmetrical pattern of larger 1920's & 30's Parisian beads and stacking zig-zag rondels in tea-leaf green, cloud blue and progressing shades from dove-gray to black, this middle size is somber in color but a strong statement piece, bold on it's own and even more fantastic layered with one or both of the shorter or longer necklaces.

-The longest is Monsoon (30"), delicate in size with pure deep colors like soft-velvety jade, cobalt, French blue, turquoise, concord grape, grass, white and mercury glass, mixtures of matte and shiny tube and seed beads from a long, long time-ago Paris, when Matisse whispered the words, "Creativity takes courage".

Bought separately, we'll donate $5 from your purchase to Room to Read, an organization supporting education for girls across Asia and Africa. You'll be donating $20 to Room to Read if you buy THE SET, three separate necklaces to wear alone or all together AND still save $20! Please visit our ROOM TO READ page for more details  on our project. Wearing our necklaces and knowing that what you've bought has provided books for deserving little girls on the other side of the world is just a beautiful way to feel we are all sisters (and brothers too!).

To see more pictures from our trips and where our inspiration springs from, visit our blog, Your Destiny is Stone Golden or come see us on Instagram at bonbonoiseau.

name: SAND from the HILL, SAND, RIVER COLLECTION
description:
The palette of the Moroccan desert against a bright blue almost-Spring sky, this is a set of necklaces, worn alone or together, describing a madcap road trip from Marrakech, up through deep Atlas Mountain passes and gorges, past fading clay kasbahs and green oases dotted with orange groves and ancient rose gardens and out into the gold moonscape that is the edge of the Sahara. This one might be my favorite and wearing it feels like poetry, a beautiful ghazal (but I say that about all the bonbons when I'm wearing them). These are the beads I wear when I'm about to uncover the raw clay tagine Jim lugged home for me from Morocco (that's another story) and all my guests say, "ooooooh!" and then, "NICE NECKLACES!"

We've been collecting glass beads on trips to France over the years, as old as 1890's Paris, produced in gorgeous colors no longer made in the world today and sewn on strong thread directly into the chain, a technique we have perfected since 2008. They are sturdy and beautiful and the SAND set is such a chic and poppy choice. Handmade in our NYC studio. Please allow 10-14 days for production.

-THE shortest is Palmaraie (19"), a whisper of a necklace in soft luscious Art Nouveau-era tube and seed beads in jade tile, soft apricot, turquoise, gold and rainwater blue 

-The medium is Dades (24"), designed in a semi-symmetrical pattern with larger 1920's & 30's Parisian glass beads and post-war Japanese resin rondels in cloud blue, lemon juice, cloud grey, apricot, brass and tangerine, with some African brass right in the middle. The DADES is a statement piece, gorgeous on it's own or layered with the others in this set for your nomadic goddess look.

-The longest is Essouiara (30") a delicate in size but strong on color line of apricot, orange and gold, fin-de-siecle shiny white tubes with dots of french blue, passages of turquoise & jade, mixtures of transparent and matte and glimmery hand-cut pyrite, as old as Matisse's favorite palette on his balcony in Tangiers and as strong as the colors he saw in the winter sun.

Bought separately, we'll donate $5 from your purchase to Room to Read, an organization supporting education for girls across Asia and Africa. $5 will buy a book for a child but you'll be donating $20 if you buy the whole set--enough for an entire shelf of books for a school library--and we'll go further to take $20 off your purchase of a set! Please visit our ROOM TO READ page for more details on our project. Wearing our necklaces and knowing that what you've bought has provided books for deserving little girls on the other side of the world is just a beautiful way to feel we are all sisters (and brothers too).

To see more pictures of our trips and where our inspiration springs, visit our blog, Your Destiny is Stone Golden or come see us on Instagram at bonbonoiseau.

name: Violet Golden Lining Beads
description:
A beautiful mix of luminous and rare vintage, new and antique seed beads, as tiny as they come and in shades of violet and bluebells. found on trips to Paris and the American West, 
Our short length is 19" and delicately grazes the collarbone. 
Our long is 32" and swings with you in a cool flash of color as you go.

Sewn into brass box chain with lobster clasp.
Handmade in NYC. Please allow up to 10 days for production.

We'll donate $5 from your purchase to Room to Read, an organization supporting education for girls across Asia and Africa. $5 will buy a book for a child. name: DANDELION Necklace from the HILL, SAND, RIVER Collection
description:
These are the gorgeous clear, bright colors from the RIVER Collection, everything about this necklace makes me fantastically happy. You can pull it longer or shorter depending on your mood or which cute outfit you decide to wear it with. Big beads paired with tiny antique Parisian seed beads and little details like the snake tongue lariat at the bottom, the pop of color and antique sequin at the back tie, the hand-cut brass beads and meticulous craftsmanship, choices and attention to detail down to the  beautiful soft off-white and black silk and cotton wrapped Japanese cord make the heart just leap and then sing. The colors of Cambodia and the gorgeous silks of Apsara costumes, this is such a showstopper with anything you decide to pair it with.

Beads as old as 1890's Paris, produced in gorgeous colors difficult to find today paired with new are picked on our trips to Paris and also found right here in NYC. Handmade in our NYC studio. Please allow 10-20 days for production.

Expandable via sliding clasp from 16" to 30".

We'll donate $5 from your purchase to Room to Read, an organization supporting education for girls across Asia and Africa. Please visit our ROOM TO READ page for more details on this project and our goal to raise $5000 to build a library. 

To see more pictures from our trips and where our inspiration springs visit our blog, Your Destiny is Stone Golden or come see us on Instagram at bonbonoiseau.

name: TEA LEAVES Necklace from the HILL, SAND, RIVER Collection
description:
These are the deep, earthy colors from the HILL Collection, everything about this necklace is amazing. You can pull it longer or shorter depending on your mood or which cute outfit you decide to wear it with. Big beads paired with tiny antique Parisian seed beads and little details like the snake tongue lariat at the bottom, the pop of color and antique sequin at the back tie, the hand-cut brass beads and meticulous craftsmanship, choices and attention to detail down to the  beautiful soft sage green and black silk and cotton wrapped Japanese cord make the heart just leap and then sing. The colors of the beautiful tea-laden hills of Southern India, this is such a beautiful piece, I wear mine layered with any of the shorter necklaces to a myriad of compliments throughout the day.

Beads as old as 1890's Paris produced in gorgeous colors difficult to find today paired with new are picked on our trips to Paris and also found right here in NYC. Handmade in our NYC studio. Please allow 10-20 days for production.

Expandable via sliding clasp from 16" to 30".

We'll donate $5 from your purchase to Room to Read, an organization supporting education for girls across Asia and Africa. Please visit our ROOM TO READ page for more details on this project and our goal to raise $5000 to build a library.

name: MOUNTAIN LILY Necklace from the HILL, SAND, RIVER Collection
description:
These are the colors of Southern Morocco, the colors of the SAND Collection. Soft and strong colors of golden dunes at sunset, deep-cut amber gorges and cobalt blues of Toureg robes and crisp blue skies. Big beads paired with tiny antique Parisian seed beads and little details like the patterned snake tongue lariat at the bottom, the pop of color and antique brass sequin at the back tie, the hand-cut brass beads and meticulous craftsmanship, choices and attention to detail down to the beautiful soft off-white and khaki silk and cotton wrapped Japanese cord make the heart just leap and then sing. The colors are easy and clear and I love wearing this with my long chocolate tank, a jean jacket and leggings but the possibilities are endless. 

Beads as old as 1890's Paris produced in gorgeous colors difficult to find today paired with new are picked on our trips to Paris and also found right here in NYC. Handmade in our NYC studio. Please allow 10-20 days for production.

Expandable via sliding clasp from 16" to 30".

We'll donate $5 from your purchase to Room to Read, an organization supporting education for girls across Asia and Africa. Please visit our ROOM TO READ page for more details on this project and our goal to raise $5000 to build a library. 

To see more pictures  from our trips and where our inspiration springs visit our blog, Your Destiny is Stone Golden or come see us on Instagram at bonbonoiseau.

name: Green Leaf Trail Earrings
description:
A swing of rare and beautiful Prohibition-era seed beads, a row of gorgeous color in the colors of the Southern Indian jungle strung onto strong vintage Japanese silk with a flash of light at the top --a sunflower of Prohibition-era metal sequins. On sterling silver French ear wires hanging 4.50" from ear.

Handmade in NYC, allow 10 days for production. 
Limited edition.

(Jaipur Trail shown on model)

We'll donate $5 from your purchase to Room to Read, an organization supporting education for girls across Asia and Africa. $5 will buy a book for a child.
